ground_truth_answer: Both groups strongly protect patient privacy, but with slightly different emphases. OCCUPY Medics actively prevent any recording or documentation of patient care, prohibiting photography, videography, and audio recording. They focus on maintaining privacy during the immediate care situation. Hippocratic physicians, as shown in both original and modern versions of the oath, take a broader view focusing on keeping private any information learned about patients' lives, both during treatment and outside of it, considering such matters 'shameful to be spoken about' and maintaining that 'all such should be kept secret.'
